data.title: If you miss Ambrosia, Apollo is a pretty good substitute
data.text: The old Ambrosia was our go-to in Rockville for Greek diner-style food for many years, and I've missed it dearly since it closed a few years back. Apollo is a pretty good (but not perfect) substitute. This was my first time back since the management changed and the dining room was refurbished. The menu is reminiscent of Ambrosia--a hodgepodge of Greek (and now Lebanese) traditional dishes and pizzas mixed in with a standard diner menu. Ordered the beef shwarma and a gyro platter--both were very good and portions were huge, although tomatoes in the salads were a light pink. Service is friendly and efficient. Prices are no longer the screaming bargains that they were under the old management, but are still decent--we got out for $43 (with tax/tip) for the two platters, a salad, dessert and soft drink. The one thing holding Apollo back from being a great diner experience is the early closing time (8:00).

data.title: An "Oasis of Comfort Food and Libation” with reasonable prices located in Rockville’s “Town Square” Chaos!
data.text: Apollo Restaurant and Bar is an “Oasis of Comfort Food and Libation” with reasonable prices located in the heart of the Rockville’s “Town Square” Chaos! If you have never dined here, you/your family and/or business associates are going to love this place. The NEW owners are warm, welcoming and generous with samples of the “Daily Specials” and new menu additions. Although most of the menu remains the same with Thursday’s special of “Fresh Roast Turkey”, including all of the homemade trimmings. Breakfast is served all day except for their “chipped beef” on toast or home fries which is only available for breakfast M-F 8:00 AM until 10:30 AM but is available all day on the weekends. As for their “Daily Specials” we are working our way through their menu board. One thing I’ll say so far is don’t miss their “Naan Bread” it’s almost like a cracker and they offer a fantastic “Kebob” medley of marinated beef, chicken and ground lamb, (the ground lamb kebob is my favorite and I don’t even like lamb). If you are in a suit, ask for the meat to be removed from the skewers, no problem for this kitchen full of professionals. That’s it I made myself hungry for some Apollo Kebobs, if you are looking for me I’ll be in my booth.

data.title: Apollo is getting a new look!!
data.text: Went for turkey dinner after several months and quickly noted an updated decor. The walls are a much brighter color which makes the whole restaurant seem lighter and brighter. There is new artwork as well. The service was quite good and the food was exactly what we were looking for. I really like the new look!!

data.title: Great local diner
data.text: Tried and true food here. It's a great menu of all types of items from breakfast to dinner. Will always go back.

data.title: Old-fashioned restaurant near Rockville Town Center
data.text: On Thursday nights, Apollo serves old-fashioned turkey dinner (turkey slices, dressing, gravy, mashed potatoes, green beans, rice pudding). Several work colleagues and I go there frequently for the turkey dinner. They also have Greek food (their specialty), pizza, sandwiches, salads and other entrees. The decor is a throwback to the 60's or 70's, but it is clean, casual and comfortable. Service and crowds are variable so don't go when you are in a hurry. It works better as a leisurely meal with friends.

data.title: slow service and mediocre food
data.text: a group went to lunch. The place was rather full. The waitress hopped around eventually getting so frustrated she quit in the middle of lunch hour. The other waitress tried but the situation was overwhelming. Food service was slow and some of our items were not delivered. The salmon on the salmon salad was not very fresh and the salad very plain. The hamburger looked very basic. The menu is extensive, perhaps too much so.

data.title: Nice Affordable Selection
data.text: Place visited by multiple coworkers so we stopped in for lunch. I had the corned beef and cabbage and it was very good. Everyone else's food was great according to then.

data.title: Just ok restaurant with a large menu
data.text: Service was slow and atmosphere is so so however my choice of food, Greek was pretty good. It has adequate free parking if you get your parking ticket validated. I was looking for a quick last minute lunch and thought I would give this place a try and was just ok.

data.title: Slow service
data.text:
Who we were: traveling family of three adults, two small children and one adult friend from the DC area.

When we went: first day arrival in Rockville, dinnertime.

What we found: Maybe I haven't kept up with Maryland state law, but the Kino games on every table and the TV blaring gambling did not enhance the ambiance. We ordered our food and then proceeded to wait a long time. At least the drinks came quickly, but that's the same at any restaurant that wants you to drain your glass quickly and reorder. There was a large party nearby that took three tables, but all the same the restaurant was not filled to capacity. It was a Saturday evening and probably the usual busy time for the staff. No excuse for making us wait so long, with no explanation from the waitress.

The food was OK. Nothing to remember fondly or go back for.

I joked to my wife on the way out that "Apollo" should be changed to "Appalling." Sorry, I'm very unfussy when it comes to diner-restaurants, but this was just an aggravation.

data.title: Meh plus
data.text: Usual greasy spoon fare.  Not bad, just not 4 or 5 stars.  Had a holiday party here.  Maybe that was the problem--menu might be better….?  Los of choices in town center.

data.title: Large menu selection
data.text: We often go to Apollo for lunch.  On Thursday's they have fresh made turkey which is used in the club sandwiches.  The salads are big and a nice selection.  They have recently added pizza to the menu and I will pick one up on my way home.  The pizza is much better than chain store brands.
